tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Keating
programme.desc: From Keatings warnings that Australia was headed for Third World status to the recession we had to have. His partnership with Bob Hawke ends in true Shakespearean style In the end Id execute him.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Jane Edmanson meets Lord Howe Islands weed team, Jerry Coleby-Williams shows how to grow bananas, Costa Georgiadis meets a family of camellia growers, and Josh Byrne finds a garden at his local intensive care unit.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: A return visit to the Museum of Steam at Swindon for a second helping of fascinating finds as Fiona Bruce and the experts scour more family treasures. Included in the program are three locomotive signs found dumped in a skip.

programme.title: Media Watch
programme.desc: BBC backlash: As the BBC grapples with its Trump-editing scandal, the spotlight has also swung onto the ABC. But is the criticism fair?

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz show in which the aim is to be interesting. The ladies and gents on the panel are Ross Noble, Kathy Lette, Sue Perkins and Alan Davies.

programme.title: Hard Quiz
programme.desc: Four contestants, one Big Brass Mug, and a host who takes no prisoners. Tom Gleeson tests his charges on their expert topics of David Fincher films, killer whales, The B-52s, and vintage sewing machines. Play along at home!

programme.title: Spicks And Specks
programme.sub-title: Its Not Your Fault, its the Time Machine
programme.desc: Gardening Australias Costa Georgiadis joins for a fun new game and there to help spread the lawn fertiliser are Robert Forster, Julia Morris, Ruva Ngwenya and Brett Blake. Plus Pseudo Echo takes us back to Funky Town.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: You Cant Ask That
programme.desc: By the end of this episode, youll have met eight remarkable people on the autism spectrum, and been given eight unique windows into a world we rarely, if ever, hear about.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Costa Georgiadis is at Queenslands Garden Expo, Tino Carnevale plants a 3D patch, Josh Byrne picks some native groundcovers, Sophie Thomson describes her more unusual vegetables, and we meet a man who only grows peonies.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: The Piano UK
programme.desc: In Leeds City Station the repertoire includes a Chopin lover whos built a street piano on wheels; a boy banging out Ibiza classics for his Dad; and a truly unique girl whose performance stops the station in its tracks.

programme.title: Restoration Australia
programme.desc: Host Anthony Burke meets a couple whove bought a huge rundown Victorian mansion in Milton, NSW and plan to restore its regal beauty and throw open its doors to the local community.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Richard Rowles plans to live with climate change, by building a flood proof house on the banks of the volatile Brisbane River.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: The Wandering Village and Challenge Accepted: Donut Fighter!
programme.desc: This week we keep civilisation going on the back of a giant creature in a review of the survival city builder The Wandering Village, plus its a new Challenge Accepted with Dragon Ball FighterZ!

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Charlie meets a creature just like him named Ralph.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: A world champion whistler pops in to help the doctors whistle - and even Billy Bones joins in!

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: As the son of a celebrity, Luka piques special interest in Bob Roth, who would do anything to make money! But Luka himself would do anything to defend his values...and his friends.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: A thieving bird plagues the farm.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Theres flamenco dancing in the lab as the doctors take a look at fat pads in your feet. Find out what to do if someone falls from height and watch out for a big Gross Alert in AandE.

programme.title: Steven Universe
programme.desc: Steven looks like a hero when he forms a magic crystal bubble around himself to protect a girl he likes from danger, but then panics when he cant figure out how to turn the bubble off!

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Chloe spends time with the Bears in an effort to research them for an upcoming presentation. But when the Bears sneak a peek at her very dry report, the Bears decide to jazz it up with exaggerated facts about themselves.

programme.title: Fresh Off The Boat
programme.desc: Its Louis favourite holiday, and he makes every attempt to scare Jessica into the Halloween spirit, but she is buried in her word processor, drafting her first horror novel. Meanwhile, Emery and Evan debate costume choices.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.desc: This week we gather some plorts and ranch some slimes in Slime Rancher 2, plus we take to the pitch in a Lets Play of FIFA 23!

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going as the sun comes up with continuous music videos, from new releases to classics and the songs weve long forgotten.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: A nature documentary follows the Bears through their normal routine.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Operation Ouch! 3D cinema is open! But how do you see the world in three dimensions? Find out as the Doctors reveal the incredible eye muscles that control how you focus on things close-up and far away.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: What if the answer to Marinettes relationship problems lay in her own past? Back when she wasnt the Marinette we know today.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: While the Farmer is away on a night out, the sheep sneak into the farmhouse for a party!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: George the tree frog joins the doctors to investigate how your Achilles tendon works using huge catapults! Plus theres a suspected spider-bite in the Emergency Department.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Zoo
programme.desc: Everyone at the zoo is waiting for the big event; the birth of Zuri the giraffes baby.

programme.title: The Mysterious Benedict Society
programme.sub-title: A Commitment to All Things Cozy
programme.desc: The Society splits up to escape an attack. Number Two and Mr. Benedict plot against Dr. Curtain.

programme.title: Rage Ausmusic Month Special
programme.desc: rage celebrates AusMusic Month all November with the creme de la creme of new music videos from Australias best and brightest.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors reveal what happens when you get diarrhoea, Dr Xand gets his skates on when he meets Alexia and Kloe from CBBCs Ice Stars to investigate how they spin without getting dizzy.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Feelings That Transcend Time: Trunks And Mai
programme.desc: Bulma gets to work repairing the old time machine that shes kept. Meanwhile, Future Trunks recalls his experiences with Mai. But two questions remain: why does Black have a time ring? And whats the extent of his power?

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: When every agent turns into a puppy, its up to Agent Ohlm to save the day.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: This episode takes place when the Bears were young cubs! On their way through the desert, the three bears come upon a giant warehouse-its like an Amazon fulfillment centre.

programme.title: Transformers: Earthspark
programme.desc: One year later, the Autobots and Terrans race against the Decepticons to collect the shards of the Emberstone before the mysteries buried beneath their sleepy town re-emerge to cause chaos.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: The Mobile Unit faces a series of challenges that Orla knew was coming from overhearing a sorcerers conversation 450 years ago. Through flashbacks, Orla shows them the times she prepared each of them for the challenges.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Operation Ouch! doctors explore the incredible human digestive system, from showing everything on the food journey from your mouth to your bum, to asking why is poo brown?

programme.title: Show Me The Honey!
programme.sub-title: Dinosaur Traitors, a Grumpy Moon and a Big Bang
programme.desc: The five wanna-beekeepers perform a pollinator survey and compete for the 6th and final Golden Honeybee in the honey cooking challenge.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil heads to West Yorkshire, to help bring a house into the present day. After three years on the market, retirees Malcolm and Muriel are desperate to sell their house and downsize to a more manageable bungalow.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Shep gets on Malik and Bentons bad side for making a racially insensitive remark after dozens of sick and malnourished children are discovered locked up in a rat-infested apartment. Mark is served with divorce papers.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: The MythBusters team focus their efforts on non-pharmaceutical treatments for seasickness and, Adam and Jamie hit the road for a fuel efficiency special.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil is in Bolton to try to turn around a tatty terrace in need of some serious TLC. Danny Zabhi bought the house in 2005 but after meeting the love of his life Siobhan, they are both keen to move on and buy a place together.

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: For better or worse, Jess and Sunny get the truth from Asif, Marty, Mel, and Juliet, and Gerry Coopers killer is revealed. But as ever, the truth leads to difficult decisions. (Final)

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Morgenstern is admitted after fracturing his leg at a Scottish family reunion. Dougs family discord becomes apparent at work when he accuses an alcoholic father of neglect. Mark hesitates to tell Rachel about the divorce.

programme.title: rage Vault: Oz 1990
programme.desc: From Icehouse to Angry Anderson, Big Pig, Tania Bowra, Peter Blakely and more rage delves into the Vault to bring you the best Australian clips of 1990.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig invites you to join her in the QI Restaurant alongside panellists Alan Davies, Phill Jupitus, Sara Pascoe and Mark Watson.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors test a theory to see if they can find out why skin goes wrinkly in the bath, Dr Chris meets a patient taking part in ground-breaking heart research, and test the power of your eyes in todays mind-bending trick.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Master And Pupil Reunited Gohan And future Trunks!
programme.desc: Repairs on the time machine continue, so Future Trunks goes to visit an old friend. However, times have changed, and the reunion isnt quite what he expected.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Dr O gets an odd illness called the Sillies.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: When Grizz comes home with a live crab, he thinks it can become a pet for the brothers to share. However, after the crab pinches Ice Bears ear and wont let go.

programme.title: Transformers: Earthspark
programme.desc: Robby invites Izzy to a drive-in movie, so all the Maltos tag along and go to extreme lengths to make it the best night ever - but theirÂ helpÂ transforms the movies science fiction into science reality...

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: Z likes a good snooze, filling the air with floaty zeds. This episode introduces the letters Y and Z and the words zap, yak, yap, yell, jazz and zigzag.

programme.title: Know It Alls: History
programme.desc: Young Luc and comedian Carlo Ritchie need to be on their best behaviour if they want to get out of the Hyde Park Barracks as they cram for a crash course in all things convicts, to be set free as the Know It All.

programme.title: The Ancient World Greece
programme.desc: In this video, we will look at the factors that caused civil war within ancient Greece and the technologies, tools and military strategies that resulted from ongoing conflict.

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: A 21-year-old fitness fanatic converts a 1920s railway carriage into a fully equipped luxury gym and sauna, and one man goes potty over converting a Victorian ladies loo into a romantic getaway.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Morgenstern is admitted after fracturing his leg at a Scottish family reunion. Dougs family discord becomes apparent at work when he accuses an alcoholic father of neglect. Mark hesitates to tell Rachel about the divorce.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Adam and Jamie set their sights on the myth that a prisoner in a supermax facility made a crossbow out of only newspaper, home made glue, a plastic dinner tray and some elastic from prison underwear.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Secret Agent Phil travels to Worthing, on what could be his toughest mission ever. Hes tasked with helping single mum Zoe to tame her house, which has got into a state thats almost unsellable.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: "Nothing to hide" - Trump backflips on Epstein files and tells House Republicans to vote for their release. Plus Trumps feud with former ally Marjorie Taylor Greene fuels a new MAGA rift. With special guest Gloria Allred.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: While Jenn sues for full custody of Rachel, Mark wrestles with self-doubt as the hospital looks to settle the OBrien suit. A sexually confused teen seeks help from Doug, and Carol babysits a bucketful of expensive worms.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: Everybody is running about in the garden so much that Makka Pakka cant wash faces.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: On his birthday, Zap decides to deliver his parcels quickly by going down his slide with all the parcels. With so many parcels Zap gets stuck. His friends must come to the rescue so his birthday party will be saved.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: When Daniel is feeling a little nervous for his first trip to the hospital, Mum and Dad Tiger prepare him for his new experience. After he arrives, Daniel meets a doctor and nurse who put him at ease and help him get better.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and his friends play Nature Explorers in Ammas garden by spinning a giant colour wheel and then finding something of that colour in the garden.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig hangs his clean football shirt out to dry, but Peppa, George and Mummy splash it with mud. They put it in the wash, but Peppa puts her red dress in too, which makes Daddys shirt pink.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer is left with a mountain of work when the farmer is rendered incapable. Enter the farmhand who is more interested in his mobile phone than getting the task done.

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: Newton wants to be a super-serious space expert.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: With so many rescue missions, Elf Rescue needs a helping hand from Children Rescue.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George learn how to talk on walkie talkies.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Its the great Sunday Roast, the day when the Potatodons hides are extra hot, crispy and delicious!

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Big Lizard and Cosima make a fantastic water ride when they dislodge an underwater rock blocking a volcanic vent. Its all good fun until they notice the sea is starting to change!

programme.title: Play School: Big Teds Time Machine
programme.desc: Get ready to groove into the 1970s with Miah and Rachael. They lace up their roller-skates for a disco party, play music on vinyl and make tie-dye shirts! Special guest Georgie Parker helps tell the story of Sven at Ten.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: When their barber goes on vacation ahead of Robotics Team picture day, the Dream Factory Crew build a grooming robot to get themselves ready for their close-up.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Lucky Striker
programme.desc: When Jay plays carrom with Ammammas lucky striker he can finally beat Amma! But when Jay loses the lucky striker his winning streak ends. Nikhil has a plan to help his brother!

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector sees the Little Girl on her skateboard. He skates too, but can Mole?

programme.title: Bananas In Pyjamas
programme.desc: The Bananas get into trouble when they realise that theyve promised to play different games with different friends all at the same time.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Discover fun ways to travel, from walking, to driving, to even flying a plane! Race with Tsehay and Captain Feathersword, then join in to craft a little sailboat!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: When Peppa gets Teddy dirty jumping in muddy puddles, she goes to The Doll Hospital.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger challenges the Baby Pea-Rexes to a race around Vegesaur Valley with no rules! First one in the water hole wins!

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: When her patients fall on slippery ice, Vida fixes their booboos AND their icy issue.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Trigger Fish
programme.desc: When hes carried away by a cyclonic waterspout, Kwazii finds himself stranded in the open ocean with a triggerfish whos made her home underneath the damaged Gup-B.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Cat Boy wants to be able to teleport to the moon like Motsuki.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Thomas has a run of bad luck, he tries everything to get back on track... even if it means following Lorenzos strange, superstitious advice!

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Costa and the kids visit a school who have reclaimed a block of land and regenerating it with local, native plants and trees. They need some help weeding and planting.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Join The Wiggles and Bubbles the Mermaid as they explore kindness and friendship! Sing along, be part of the happiness and fun - its time to Wiggle and Learn!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Wendy Wolfs birthday is here and she has invited Peppa and friends around for a party.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: When Twig steals Cosimas volleyball, a chase leads Big Lizard and Cosima to her den, and a happy discovery!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Pounce, Frizzy and Gemma each have their own personal superstar lifeguard hero. But during an action-packed ride-along day, they discover that its not about the individual, but the team.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: The PJs are desperate to get their vehicles back from Carly and Cartoka, but are having trouble taming their Crystal Animals to help them - and to make matters worse, PJ Robot is kidnapped as the battery for the Flashcar.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Jonathan and Paddington find a treasure map in a bottle on the lake! Judy and Toq also find a treasure map, but who will find the treasure first?

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Ben and Holly want to play with Gaston the ladybird but he is missing. Nanny Plum uses her magic crystal ball to retrace Gastons steps and find his whereabouts...

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.sub-title: Secret Origin of the Batwheels Part 3
programme.desc: The newly-minted Batwheels must defend the Batcave! Part 3.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: The Tombliboos and Makka Pakka take a ride on the Ninky Nonk. The Tombliboos trousers fly off and whiz around the Ninky Nonk!

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: The first tomato of the season is so delicious that Squidgie grows more and more and more until her friends are sick of eating them. No one wants to tell Squidgie because they dont want to hurt her feelings.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: When Daniel and his friends are setting up a lemonade stand, they have lots of things to remember - especially the lemons! Saying their list out loud helps them remember all the ingredients.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing has enough money to buy one thing in Padgets shop but he finds it hard to choose between all the lovely things. After much deliberation Bing chooses a campervan but on the way home he begins to regret his decision.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George go on a boat trip with Grandpa Pig, but they must send Polly Parrot for help when their boat runs aground. Polly fetches Granny Pig and Grandad Dog, who rescues them in his boat.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: After spending the night putting together the bed instead of sleeping in it, the farmer has a lie in and Bitzer is in charge of making sure his masters rest is uninterrupted.

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: The Power Heroes team have been glooped by Gloop the Third. Only Newton can stop him, but to do so, he has to take himself less seriously.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly and Ben spend a day at Lucys school, whilst trying not to be spotted by Lucys teacher, Miss Cookie.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig makes Peppa her very own office.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: The volcano is active which means the baby Pea-Rexes get to play Pea Shooter. Ginger manages to find her own way to join in.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: When all the vegetables from their garden are stolen detectives Cosima and Big Lizard investigate all over the neighbourhood, only to return to the scene of the crime!

programme.title: Play School: Big Teds Time Machine
programme.desc: Emma and Teo turn back the clock to the radical 1980s! Put in the cassette and slide on your leg warmers for an aerobics session with Shannon Dooley! Big Ted gets into 80s games and George Spartels joins in too.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: The Dream Factory Crew, Carlos and his pet cockatiel, Leon, make new friends when another cockatiel flies into the Dream Factory and their adventures begin.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Wriggly Worries
programme.desc: When Jay finds a worm in the garden, the family decide to have a worm charming championship! Nikhils not so sure about worms. He has a spot of wriggly worries and doesnt want to take part.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector and Mole find an icy puddle, but its not only for playing on.

programme.title: Bananas In Pyjamas
programme.desc: When the Bananas discover a talking bird in the forest, they have trouble proving to the Teddies that its real.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Learn all about animals with The Wiggles! From Wags the Dog to the animals of the jungle, the trees, and even the snow, there are plenty of animals to see!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Wendy Wolfs birthday is here and she has invited Peppa and friends around for a party.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Big Lizard frustrates Dad by stealing a strange plant from the ship. A disaster is averted when Big Lizard persuades Dad theres more to this plant than meets the eye. And nose...

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: Vidas usually the vet, but when she twists an ankle, shes the patient and all of Sweetwood helps!

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: The Octonauts get more than they bargained for when they use the Octopod to transport a pair of invasive lionfish back to their native habitat.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Speed-obsessed twin villains steal and destroy the PJ vehicles with help from their Gigantogarage and mega fast Flashcar.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas helps his friend Ace overcome his fear of animals so that he can compete in the Super Stunt Rally.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Hannah works with two brothers to create a garden that delights all of the senses. Alfie is vision impaired and loves being active and playing, so they create a garden of games he can enjoy with his brother, William.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Get ready for a musical adventure with The Wiggles and all their Wiggly friends! Explore musical dynamics, count along with the Tree of Wisdom, and Join Tsehay and Anthony as they create musical sounds in the Wiggly Kitchen!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its Captain Daddy Dogs birthday and Mummy Dog surprises him with the gift of a boat trip, which isnt quite what he expected.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Cosima and Big Lizards solar-powered hoverboards run out of battery as night falls. Some troublesome glowbugs are attracted to Big Lizards dinner and manage to save the day!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Big Trev is worried about passing his annual lifeguard fitness test, so Frizzy offers to help with an early morning boot camp.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: The PJs get caught up in a battle between Romeo and the twins.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Mr. Gruber has always wanted to go to Italy and Paddington sets about helping his friend achieve his dream!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: King Thistle wants a boiled egg for his breakfast but Mr Elf has forgotten to bring him one. The elves decide to deliver the King the chickens from the Elf Farm so he can have an egg whenever he likes!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Bam must rally the Batwheels as their confident leader to stop the turbo-Ducky!

programme.title: Keating
programme.desc: From Keatings warnings that Australia was headed for Third World status to the recession we had to have. His partnership with Bob Hawke ends in true Shakespearean style In the end Id execute him.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow in Perth.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch
programme.desc: Singer Paul Kelly joins Bridget, James and the team, as well as actor and author Bryan Brown, Sir Tony Robinson, Storyteller chef Zach Green plus our resident movie critic Zak Hepburn.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: Culture By Design
programme.desc: Design is a reflection of history, heritage and identity. This episode explores cultural roots that influence modern design with a wood block printer in Bangalore, fashion designer in Jakarta and furniture designer in Mumbai.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC News Day
programme.desc: As every story unfolds, catch each breaking moment and stay up to date. Ros Childs brings you the latest news, interviews, analysis and original reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Afternoon Briefing
programme.desc: Your daily download of everything you need to know about politics, national and global affairs. Patricia Karvelas asks politicians the tough questions and talks to key players and experts on the issues driving the news cycle.

programme.title: ABC News Hour
programme.desc: Stay in the know with Australias trusted news source. From your neighbourhood, across the country and around the world, ABC News bring you the days top stories and latest news, all verified. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: The home of breaking news and in-depth coverage of the big stories from across Australia and around the globe. The ABCs network of reporters cover important stories and all the news you need. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News. Weve got more reporters in more places, connecting communities and covering the stories and issues that matter to you. Presented by Michael Tetlow.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: Spies In The Outback
programme.desc: In the grip of a crippling drought, Alice Springs sees an economic lifeline in the 1960s when America comes knocking promising to build a space base on the edge of the desert town. The space base isnt quite what it seems.

programme.title: Creative Types With Virginia Trioli
programme.desc: Shes queen of TV and a celebrated theatre actor, but when Marta Dusseldorp moved her life and family to Tasmania she didnt exit the stage - she stepped up and became a producer for whom place and community is paramount.

programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: Play On
programme.desc: Connor OLeary, a Cronulla surfer who now surfs for Japan. Pasifika rugby league players on their connection to their homeland. And Gronya Somerville, a badminton player exploring her ties to Chinese aristocracy.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to tell you whats happening and why it matters. Ros Childs brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of the days best stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Girish Sawlani presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Boyer Lecture Series
programme.desc: James Curran, author and professor, argues that the US Presidency holds advantages for Australia, if we are brave enough to take them, and to confront possible changes in our historic alliance, in his speech Trumps Gift.
